meanings.definition: A person who sits next to another person, especially in a vehicle or at a public event.
meanings.sent1: My seatmates on the bus were friendly and chatty.
meanings.sent2: During the flight, my seatmates and I shared travel stories.
meanings.sent3: The seatmates at the concert all sang along to the music together.
meanings.sent4: In the crowded stadium, my seatmates felt like long-lost friends.
meanings.sent5: The seatmates in the theater whispered excitedly about the upcoming show.

meanings.definition: The people who sit next to each other in a particular seating arrangement.
meanings.sent1: At the wedding, my seatmates were distant relatives I hadn't seen in years.
meanings.sent2: In the classroom, my seatmates and I often worked on projects together.
meanings.sent3: During the conference, my seatmates and I accidentally swapped name tags.
meanings.sent4: In the cafeteria, my seatmates always saved me a spot at their table.
meanings.sent5: The seatmates on the roller coaster screamed in unison as the ride dropped.
